name: It's the Fuzz!
description: Larkin has been captured... but Starfleet science officers fear he may have already put his plans into motion. Investigate reports of tribbles appearing in places--and timelines--they don't belong.
rules:
-- Unique Supply Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using any version of Uhura, Spock, Dax, Tribble Kirk, or crew with Exobiologist or Tribbled traits will provide a bonus to Supply Missions.
-- Every Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- Community Rewards are only available during Phase 1. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Uhura, Spock, Dax, Tribble Kirk, Exobiologists, or Tribbled
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Supply Missions!

featured_crew.name: Sulu
featured_crew.flavor: A large number of cute tribbles give peace and rest.

featured_crew.name: Spock
featured_crew.flavor: Spock suggests that the cause of the tribbles’ death was something in the grain they were eating.

featured_crew.name: J. Dax
featured_crew.flavor: Transported to the past via the Orb of Time, Jadzia stopped a Klingon attempt on Kirk's life.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Spock
rewards.flavor: Recovering on Vulcan, Commander Spock spent much time retraining his logical mind.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Credits
rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Voyage Revival
rewards.flavor: Use to instantly revive a failed Voyage.

rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.name: Skill
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 6 Polestars: Command, Diplomacy, Security, Engineering, Science, Medicine

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Merits
rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Sulu
rewards.flavor: A large number of cute tribbles give peace and rest.

rewards.name: J. Dax
rewards.flavor: Transported to the past via the Orb of Time, Jadzia stopped a Klingon attempt on Kirk's life.

adventures.name: Rollin', Rollin', Rollin'
adventures.description: Study the ambulatory nature of tribbles.

adventures.name: Rope 'Em, Throw 'Em
adventures.description: Create a safe but effective capture tool for tribbles.

adventures.name: Head 'Em Up
adventures.description: Create an attractant to cause tribbles to gather.

adventures.name: Tribble Density Index
adventures.description: A method for measuring the number of tribbles per parsec.

rewards.name: It's the Fuzz!
rewards.flavor: Event Victory Points

rewards.name: J. Dax
rewards.flavor: Transported to the past via the Orb of Time, Jadzia stopped a Klingon attempt on Kirk's life.

rewards.name: Spock
rewards.flavor: Spock suggests that the cause of the tribbles’ death was something in the grain they were eating.

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

goals.flavor: Seek out tribbles in the Terran Empire.
Learn whether tribbles have overrun the KCA.
Discover if tribbles are transwarping with the Borg.

screens.text: "Sorry to be the bearer of bad news... but we think our victory over Edward Larkin was premature. We're getting reports of tribbles in places there really shouldn't be tribbles. Not that there's anywhere tribbles should be."

"While we do not know the exact nature of Lieutenant Larkin's plans, we suspect he may have set them into motion before he was apprehended. The tribble species continues to spread across our present timeline."

"I've been collecting and organizing reports, as well as coordinating the response effort. I know these creatures seem harmless, but if we don't stop them now, they'll become a force of nature, one we might not be able to stop."

"Sorry to be the bearer of bad news... but we think our victory over Edward Larkin was premature. We're getting reports of tribbles in places there really shouldn't be tribbles. Not that there's anywhere tribbles should be."

"While we do not know the exact nature of Lieutenant Larkin's plans, we suspect he may have set them into motion before he was apprehended. The tribble species continues to spread across our present timeline."

"I've been collecting and organizing reports, as well as coordinating the response effort. I know these creatures seem harmless, but if we don't stop them now, they'll become a force of nature, one we might not be able to stop."

"Don't hate me... but I don't think we're done yet. Tribble numbers are down in our own timeline... but we're now getting reports from people arriving from other timelines... and they aren't arriving alone, either.

responses.text: "How could Larkin send tribbles into every timeline and universe?"
"Just to play devil's advocate--are the tribbles actually helping, at all?"
"I've had enough. Let's eject all tribbles into space--and Larkin with them."

screens.text: "Temporal anomalies bring--and take--individuals from different timelines and universes into ours every hour. Now, they're arriving with tribbles. Some of these individuals arrive in a state of panic, and they're relieved to escape what sounds like their own overrun timelines."
"Such an action would violate Federation principles and Starfleet regulation. It is not the fault of the tribble that it was engineered poorly and manipulated foolishly."

"Let's be optimistic as long as we can. Maybe it's only some other timelines and universes, not all of them. If we can figure out which ones, maybe we can figure out how Larkin pulled this off, and undo it."

"Don't hate me... but I don't think we're done yet. Tribble numbers are down in our own timeline... but we're now getting reports from people arriving from other timelines... and they aren't arriving alone, either.

responses.text: "How could Larkin send tribbles into every timeline and universe?"
"Just to play devil's advocate--are the tribbles actually helping, at all?"
"I've had enough. Let's eject all tribbles into space--and Larkin with them."

screens.text: "Temporal anomalies bring--and take--individuals from different timelines and universes into ours every hour. Now, they're arriving with tribbles. Some of these individuals arrive in a state of panic, and they're relieved to escape what sounds like their own overrun timelines."
"Such an action would violate Federation principles and Starfleet regulation. It is not the fault of the tribble that it was engineered poorly and manipulated foolishly."

"Let's be optimistic as long as we can. Maybe it's only some other timelines and universes, not all of them. If we can figure out which ones, maybe we can figure out how Larkin pulled this off, and undo it."
